instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LCD_PWR_EN: What is LCD_PWR_EN? LCD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip that supplies power to the LCD screen to turn on..
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .
definitions.CPU_VCORE: What is CPU_VCORE? Power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video
threads.message: Hi. This board chimes and boots. No internal external video. No liquid damage. Missing PP3V3_ <SIGNAL>SW_LCD</SIGNAL>. <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is 0.12V. No short on line. (.537). Heated GPU to 100 C. No change. Thanks, have a good one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video
threads.message:
We all know where this is going.....
Is it a nice Apple refurb with no serial number on the RAM slot?

threads.message:
[USER="36"]aprendiz[/USER] ... Thanks for the response, I will check.

[USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] ... Lol!! ... Idk man. I dont remember. I will check in the morning. 

Thanks. Have a good one guys.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video
threads.message:
Hi. I have 1.12V on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL>. Thanks.

It actually does have serial number.

[url]https://photos.app.goo.gl/RR2EjOaN364ZiXT83[/url]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video
threads.message: GPU voltage should drop down to 0.9V once GPU is initialized. Was this thing already messed with? Check all the caps in the PCIE lines to the GPU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video
threads.message: Edge bonding is still in tact. No burnt up probe points or caps on board. Only thing not original was thermal compound. I will check your suggestion. Thanks. Have a good night.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video
threads.message:
Hi Duke.

<CAPACITOR>C8145</CAPACITOR> - <CAPACITOR>C8150</CAPACITOR> All look good. Voltage @ 1.759
<CAPACITOR>C8151</CAPACITOR> - <CAPACITOR>C8158</CAPACITOR> Look good as well, Voltage @ .974

Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video
threads.message: Diode mode can't be 0 of course.....what is going on there?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video

idk. you said both sides. Thats ground. :) no?

Sorry man. Im confused.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video
threads.message: PCIE data line caps are <CAPACITOR>C8020</CAPACITOR> and that whole bunch.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video
threads.message: ohhhh. Well that explains a lot. Sorry. To be honest I saw PCIE on pg 74 and thought thats what you were talking about.

Unfortunately this is one of the boards I put into the U.S. mostly working, and came out non working. Not chiming now. Working on getting it going again.
